name: Teknologi for integrerte operasjoner og semantisk web

questions.question: [C#/.NET] Which of the following statements is FALSE about the .NET CLR?
answers: It provides a language-neutral development & execution environment.
It ensures that an application would not be able to access memory that it is not authorized to access
It provides services to run "managed" applications.
It provides services to run "unmanaged" applications.

questions.question: [C#/.NET] Which of the following are NOT true about .NET Framework?
answers: It provides a consistent object-oriented programming environment whether object code is stored and executed locally, executed locally but Internet-distributed, or executed remotely.
It provides a code-execution environment that minimizes software deployment and versioning conflicts.
It provides a code-execution environment that promotes safe execution of code, including code created by an unknown or semi-trusted third party.
It provides different programming models for Windows-based applications and Web-based applications.
It provides an event driven programming model for building Windows Device Drivers.

questions.question: [C#/.NET] Which of the following is a correct way to create an object of the class Sample?
[C#/.NET] Which of the following statements is correct about the C#.NET code snippet given below?
answers: j cannot be declared as public.
DisplayData() cannot be declared as private.
There is no error in this class.

questions.question: [C#/.NET] If a class is using an INTERFACE, it must
answers: inherit the properties of the interface
contain the same methods as the interface

questions.question: [.Net and Semantic Web, Silverlight] XAML is used …
answers: to interoperate Silverlight applications in Linux
as a protocol for network applications in Silverlight
to develop user interface components in Silverlight
to package all the libraries of a Silverlight application

questions.question: [.Net and Semantic Web, Silverlight] Beside Silverlight, which of the following technologies does not use the XAML language?

[Web Services, WCF and SOA] Which of the alternatives below lists technologies, in the same order, corresponding to the following items:
1) represent data (structured storage), 2) message protocol, 3) data- and operation contract.
[Web Services, WCF and SOA] This text snippet is most likely taken from...
answers: A WSDL file saved on disk
A WSDL generated by a running web service
A SOAP Message being transmitted between server and client.

questions.question: [Web Services, WCF and SOA] Given the code in C#, written for a WCF service. What are we trying to create here?
[Web Services, WCF and SOA] What is the relation between SOA (Service Oriented Architecture) and WCF?
answers: WCF and SOA is the same
WCF is Microsoft’s platform for, amongst others, building SOA applications
SOA is a specific technology, WCF is a generalized view of how distributed applications should be built

questions.question: [Web Services, WCF and SOA] You connected to a web service, and invoked a call to a function. In which format are you getting the results back?
[Windows Workflow Foundation] Every workflow has a GUID which identifies the workflow. It is used to
answers: Keep the database in normalized form.
Achieve long running executing by loading/unloading the workflow in the memory.
Allow the input/out of the workflow to be formatted in XML

questions.question: [Windows Workflow Foundation] The state of the workflows can be saved in a database. This service is provided by
[Windows Workflow Foundation] Can you integrate workflow applications with some other applications, such as Windows Forms applications and Web applications?
[Real Time Communication] What does SIP (Session Initiation Protocol) do?
answers: Sets up, manages and tears down sessions (such a voice or video calls) between parties
Sets up, transfers/communicates the content of sessions (for instance the video images if it is a video call) and tears down sessions
Replaces IP (Internet Protocol) for multimedia calls/sessions (such as voice calls) since IP is not well suited for such applications
Compresses voice or video data to achieve better quality when doing multimedia calls over low bandwidth links

questions.question: [SemWeb Intro] What is the purpose of the ontology in the Semantic Web?
answers: A model that defines an unambiguous terminology for giving meaning to data and docu-ments
A semantic language for modeling domain phenomena
A stack of languages that replaces HTML and XML for the World Wide Web
A model that uniquely identifies web resources
A database model for web applications

questions.question: [SemWeb Intro] What is not a property of ontologies?
answers: Represents a shared understanding of a domain
Abstract model of some domain phenomena

questions.question: [SemWeb Intro] What is the relationship between XML and RDF in the Semantic Web stack of languages?
answers: XML and RDF together make up RDFS
RDF defines the presentation of XML documents
XML and RDF are both subsumed by OWL
XML is formally defined by RDF tuples

questions.question: [SemWeb Intro] What is a URI?
[SemWeb Intro] Which of these languages is based on Description Logic?
[RDF Modelling] RDF triples consist of subject, objects and properties.  What cannot be an object in an RDF triple?
[RDF Modelling] Which type of list is defined in RDFS?
[OWL Modelling] What is the correct relationship between owl:Thing and owl:Nothing?
answers: owl:Nothing is a subclass of owl:Thing
owl:Nothing is a superclass of owl:Thing that cannot have instances
owl:Nothing and owl:Thing are both subclasses of owl:Resource
owl:Nothing and owl:Thing are disjoint classes

questions.question: [OWL Modelling] What is a transitive property in OWL?
answers: If x is not related to y and y is not related to z, then x is not related to z
If x is related to y and x is related to z, then y is related to z
If x is related to y, there can be no other z related to x with the same property
If x is related to y, then y is related to x
If x is related to y and y is related to z, then x is related to z

questions.question: [OWL Modelling] What is true about X?
answers: X is a subclass of C1
X is a a property of C1
X is an instance of C2
X is an instance of C3

questions.question: [Semantics and Reasoning] What are the basic primitives in Description Logic?
[Semantics and Reasoning] An interpretation in Description Logic is defined by means of a domain D and an interpretation function I.  How are roles interpreted?
answers: Roles are mapped onto binary relations over D
Roles are mapped onto elements of D
Roles are mapped onto subsets over D
Roles are mapped onto triples of elements of D

questions.question: [Ontology Engineering and Quality] What does it mean that a class is inconsistent?
answers: The class contains individuals that are also members of other classes
The class is interpreted as equivalent to another class in any model
There are no instances of the class
The existence of the class depends on the existence of another class
The class is interpreted as empty in any model

questions.question: [Ontology Engineering and Quality] Which class is a rigid class?
[Ontology Engineering and Quality] Why is this taxonomy not a correct ontology structure?
answers: Joint cannot be taxonomically linked to both Arm and Leg
Both Finger and Palm cannot be taxonomically linked to Hand
Fingers and palms are individuals, not classes
None of these relationships are subclass relationships
